c74object.name: fl.info~
c74object.digest: Outputs the sample rate, number of channels and length of a specified buffer
c74object.description: The units for reporting length can be set with the units parameter. If the named buffer is not found all outputs are given as zero.

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the units for reporting the length of the buffer.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds

objarg.name: buffer
objarg.description:
This argument sets the buffer parameter:
Sets the buffer to use.

objarg.name: units
objarg.digest: Sets the units for reporting the length of the buffer
objarg.description:
This argument sets the units parameter:
Sets the units for reporting the length of the buffer.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.info~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.info~. When set to 0 fl.info~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.info~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
